snippet: The three-stage complex of the National Theater in London allows for one particularly meaningful tradition, described by an American visitor and participant, John Lithgow.
abstract: John Lithgow, who is starring in Pinero's The Magistrate at National Theater in London, describes his experience participating in British stage tradition where actors drum on their dressing room windows before show on opening night.
lead_paragraph: The three-stage complex of the National Theater in London allows for one particularly meaningful tradition, described by an American visitor and participant, John Lithgow.

headline.seo: John Lithgow’s Discovery at Britain’s National Theater
headline.main: A Lone Yank Takes Joy in Togetherness
